intro: Pseudosopubia kituiensis, commonly known as the Kitui thornveld, is a shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually small and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
